description: Borrowed from Latin suffixum (“suffix”), from sub (“subordinate”) + fixus, perfect passive participle of figere (“to fasten, fix”).

entries.meaning: (grammar, linguistic morphology) A morpheme added at the end of a word to modify the word's meaning.
(computing) A final segment of a string of characters.
examples: The string "abra" is both a prefix and a suffix of the string "abracadabra".

verbs.description: suffix (third-person singular simple present suffixes, present participle suffixing, simple past and past participle suffixed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To append (something) to the end of something else.
